description: Number of orbits of length n under a map whose periodic points are counted by A056045.
comments: The sequence A056045 records the number of points of period n under a map. The number of orbits of length n for this map gives the sequence above.
references: Yash Puri and Thomas Ward, A dynamical property unique to the Lucas sequence, Fibonacci Quarterly, Volume 39, Number 5 (November 2001), pp. 398-402.
links: Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
formula: If a(n) is the n-th term of A056045, then the n-th term is u(n) = (1/n)* Sum_{ d divides n }\mu(d)a(n/d)
example: u(7) = 1 since the map whose periodic points are counted by A056045 has 1 fixed point and 8 points of period 7, hence 1 orbits of length 7.
author: Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk), Mar 13 2001
